value.title: Federal agencies are rapidly increasing their use of facial recognition
value.excerpt: The U.S. Government Accountability Office released a report on Aug. 24, 2021, detailing current and planned use of facial recognition technology.

value.title: Judge Ends NYCLU Suit Against School Facial Recognition

value.title: Rank One to campaign for ethical facial recognition commitment from providers
value.excerpt: Rank One Computing declares its intention to take a strong stand on ethics in facial recognition use, in coordination with the Security Industry Association.

value.title: Mumbai: 470 CCTV cameras with face recognition to help fight crime on WR

value.title: Using AI and Computer Vision to Reduce Misinformation on the Web
value.excerpt: The spread of misinformation via deepfakes, document manipulation and false narratives is fairly common on the internet today.

value.title: China’s new data laws are a risk factor in a facial-recognition giant’s IPO filing
value.excerpt: The firm's lengthy list of risk factors is a reminder that Chinese tech champions face rising scrutiny in both Beijing and Washington.

value.title: Indian Railways installs a facial recognition system to track commuters
value.excerpt: Indian Railways has installed a network of nearly 500 facial recognition cameras to track millions of daily commuters, a report in the Financial Times suggested.

value.title: Army Wants to Install Facial Recognition, Video Analytics at Child Development Centers
value.excerpt: The Army wants to use facial recognition and advanced machine learning algorithms to monitor kids at base Children Development Centers and plans to launch a pilot program at Fort Jackson in the near future.

value.title: The Free-Speech Case for Facial Recognition | Opinion
value.excerpt: The right to communicate anonymously is important, but most would agree it shouldn't extend to people who commit violent crimes.

value.title: Celebrity spotting: Amazon improves facial recognition for famous people
value.excerpt: Amazon promises its Rekognition machine-learning tech will save hours of humans tagging photos and videos of celebrities.

value.title: Recognize celebrities in images and videos using Amazon Rekognition
value.excerpt: The celebrity recognition feature in Amazon Rekognition automatically recognizes tens of thousands of well-known personalities in images and videos using machine learning (ML). value.title: US federal agencies plan to increase facial recognition use, GAO report says
value.excerpt: Three-quarters of U.S. federal agencies surveyed for a Government Accountability Office (GAO) report are already using facial recognition.

value.title: iPhone 13 Face ID could work with face masks and foggy glasses

value.title: Clearview AI Offered Free Facial Recognition Trials To Police All Around The World
value.excerpt: As of February 2020, 88 law enforcement and government-affiliated agencies in 24 countries outside the United States have tried to use controversial facial recognition technology Clearview AI, according to a BuzzFeed News investigation.

value.title: Hybrid AI Is The Future Of Industrial Analytics
value.excerpt: Industrial DataOps is the starting point to solving one of the key challenges of industrial digitalization: enabling hybrid AI solutions at scale.

value.title: UniSA researchers develop AI facial recognition tech to monitor premature babies
value.excerpt: University of South Australia boasts the AI-based system it has developed to remotely monitor the vital signs of babies rival the accuracy of ECG.

value.title: Google Nest Doorbell review: Catching up to the competition
value.excerpt: Our Google Nest Doorbell review will tell you why this fine smart doorbell is more about catching up to competitors than anything else.

value.title: The New Nest Doorbell Cam Is a Reminder That Nest Has Gone Fully Google
value.excerpt: Google's cheaper doorbell security camera offers a lot for less, but you make some sacrifices for those savings.

value.title: The use of facial recognition by the Delhi police could make systemic biases against Muslims worse
value.excerpt: The Delhi police have been equipping their control room vehicles with facial recognition systems, and have already made at least 42 arrests with the help of this technology.

value.title: Amazon Rekognition Custom Labels Demo
value.excerpt: Amazon Rekognition Custom Labels is a feature of Amazon Rekognition that enables customers to build their own specialized machine learning (ML) based image analysis capabilities to detect unique objects and scenes integral to their specific use case.

value.title: AI ROI: Computer Vision
value.excerpt: Computer vision is now a reality. Get immediate business value like improved quality and reduced losses from the practical AI deployment platform, Chooch AI.

value.title: Virtual dressing room startup Revery.ai applying computer vision to the fashion industry
value.excerpt: Revery.ai is developing a tool that leverages computer vision and artificial intelligence to create a better online dressing room experience.

value.title: Civil liberties groups demand government bans facial recognition cameras
value.excerpt: Police and Home Office are accused of bypassing parliament over guidance allowing officers, local councils and enforcement agencies to use facial recognition across England and Wales in defiance of court rulings against invasive filming.

value.title: PI and 30 CSOs unite against use of live facial recognition technology
value.excerpt: PI, together with 30 national and international civil society organisations (CSOs), release an open letter calling on Parliament and relevant stakeholders to halt and ban the use of live facial recognition technology (LFRT) by the police and private companies.

value.title: Australia eyes AI, drones, facial recognition tech to protect wild koalas
value.excerpt: Researchers are seeking hi-tech solutions to protect koalas against the threats of vehicle collisions and bush fires.
